text:
Hi Everyone, I have a question

I am currently on a free account and i am building an integration with our application. I was trying to create a custom object using OAuth authentication. But I am getting the following error.

"The scope needed for this API call isn't available for public use. If you have questions, contact support or post in our developer forum."

API: <https://api.HubSpot.com/crm/v3/schemas>

Could anyone let me know whether we need to be in a paid plan to access the api

Thanks in Advance

Hi Guys
Good day
I need some guidance
I used below to get some data from “Deals”
GET
<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/deals/4355874207>
got below results
```{
    "id": "4355874207",
    "properties": {
        "amount": null,
        "closedate": null,
        "createdate": "2021-02-25T07:10:19.217Z",
        "dealname": "Miga Mind Company Limited",
        "dealstage": "305989",
        "hs_lastmodifieddate": "2021-09-07T09:38:29.441Z",
        "hs_object_id": "4355874207",
        "pipeline": "ee446175-450f-4c21-9eca-7d59bded679f"
    },
    "createdAt": "2021-02-25T07:10:19.217Z",
    "updatedAt": "2021-09-07T09:38:29.441Z",
    "archived": false
}```
I don’t see the “associated contacts” data in it
How I can retrieve it?
Please assist
Do we have an example for import contacts csv for the given api? using curl or postman

Hey guys,
I need help with batch updating contact properties, I want to id them by email instead of by HubSpot id, I tried to use "idProperty" : "email" but I cant get it to work, can someone quickly help me with this? Thanks
Alright, I just learned there's no way to find this information automatically with HubSpot.  Any thought on there on how to map API sources?

What have people out there used to diagram your HS portal's data model?  Has anyone created a ERD of your unique HS configuration and integrations?  How was it done and what specific tools were used?  Any advice is welcomed!

If you are looking to figure this out, I think you would need to create workflows that trigger on properties being “known” those trigger once a property value changes.

NOW, that doesn’t really answer your question, and will send you down a rabbit hole and likely not get you what you are looking for.

If you have super admin you can look at your api logs `<https://app.HubSpot.com/api-key/{portalid}/call-log>` or by going to settings, integrations, api key

That will not likely get you what you are really looking for as well.

I think what you are looking for is for those integrations to log out some sort of report — and that will likely need to be you modifying the code (if it is private apps and you have access) or asking the integrator how to view these logs
you can’t use oauth to authenticate to create a custom object. You need to authenticate using an api key or private app, and maybe api keys are deprecated, I cannot remember what the date was
Once you have the DEAL ID, then you can get the assocateid contacts from it using the assocations api <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/associations>
what given api? Are you using the import api or a batch or batch create? What are you trying to do?
you need to get the id to make the batch work, meaning you would need to look up the contact by email and return the contact id from there
`/crm/v3/objects/contacts/search` <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts>

Hi Nicholas!  You've captured exactly what I'm looking for and laid out the option well.  Makes sense, thank you!  It sounds like it's more work than I had hoped for, but at least I have some direction now :+1:
When i look at the import api docs there is no example for the post requestm
I’m curious about this. Have you asked in the partner slack or in the facebook group?

good luck, you will be down some rabbit holes for sure.

If you have operations hub and can write some custom code in your workflow, you could use these updates and write using the files api to a file in the file manager and create your own logs.

I’ve had to do this for some wonky workflows I’ve created and needed to monitor them externally and not be in HubSpot all the time watching and testing… just throwing that out there
No, I haven't.  I will though.  Do you have links handy for the two communities?  Either way, I can include you on the threads.

facebook group: <https://www.facebook.com/groups/732402100281543>

If you aren’t in it it takes a minute to get approved
slack channel <https://offers.HubSpot.com/partners/slack-team>
can you send me what you are looking at?
Cool, thanks again Nicholas
Hm is there no other way? For single contact updates you can use the email, although its not documented in the API
It is documented, it is documented right here: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/update_contact-by-email>
if you don’t have IDs you can’t batch update

in the old API this was possible:
<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/batch_create_or_update>
have you tried that?
I didn’t realize that ever existed in v1
Also you can't create custom objects on a free account just enterprise accounts

Hi all. I'm new to HubSpot and setting things up to submit form data to HubSpot through the API (private app). I've setup the private app, have the token, and trying to test in Postman but getting the following error...

> "Invalid input JSON on line 1, column 11: Cannot deserialize value of type `java.util.ArrayList<com.HubSpot.formsubmission.common.models.FormSubmissionValue>` from Object value (token `JsonToken.START_OBJECT`)"
This is the documentation I'm using and have plugged in my portalID as well as my formGUID into the URI: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form>

I'm sure it has to do with the JSON file I'm using in Postman but not sure why it's not working. This is the contents of the JSON file...

{"fields":{"objectTypeId": "0-1","name":"email","value":"<mailto:tester@testinginc.com|tester@testinginc.com>"}}
Does it mean this is not possible in the new API. I have a property that I want to update for a particular contact
That is what I’m assuming, they didn’t port over the ability to update by email in newer versions of the api
But it is possible to do that by contact id in the new API?
I’m sorry, what are you asking? If it is possible to update contacts via the api?
All the endpoints are here
you can update any contact via the api if you have their contact id
you can also batch update
anyone here who has created custom workflow actions through apps that is willing to have a quick chat to help me out with something?
Hi, does anyone know if there's a link to all the contact property names and how I should specify them when using the Api?

<@U03SWRNM3HD> you can find all the internal names for the properties in the property editor <https://app.HubSpot.com/property-settings/21896839/properties?search=first+name&type=0-1>
(Replace 21896839) with your hub ID

Hi all, any reason a Private App should let me GET all /object/products but *not* PATCH /objects/products/productid?
For the PATCH call I get back a 403 and `One or more of the following scopes are required: e-commerce`

--but… the GET also requires e-commerce, and that worked:thinking_face:

(and Scopes for the private app does not have a separate read/write setting for e-commerce, only Request - and it is ticked, of course)
-- hmm only fails in one of the 3 accounts I have access to. I'll use another :smile:
Awesome, thanks <@U01QVR44MEY>
For sure
There's also an API for that :wink:

Nov 30 sunset date for API key.
If you have a legit use case for creating custom objects with oauth (something that would be viable in the marketplace) there is a request form you can fill out to get access.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/custom-objects-schema-pilot|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/custom-objects-schema-pilot>
true true
You can bundle custom object with developer projects ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
Hi <@U25PYL3Q8>.. Good day.. Thanks for the update.. Need some guidance

I guess I want to use POST method to *search* by *deal name* and retrieve “dealID” and “associated contacts”, so that I can use the response variable to create a new deal if it doesn’t exist in HubSpot via HTTP request from my own platform
Thank you
where I can find the association type?
the thing is for the single contact update it is possible via email, its just not documented in the new api endpoint. So its probably the same for batch updating
